import org.apache.spark.graphx._
import org.apache.spark.sql._
import org.apache.spark.sql.types._

category	description	id	img	tags	title
Database	The Apache Cassandra database is the right choice when you need scalability and high availability without compromising performance. Linear scalability and proven fault-tolerance on commodity hardware or cloud infrastructure make it the perfect platform for mission-critical data. Cassandra's support for replicating across multiple datacenters is best-in-class, providing lower latency for your users and the peace of mind of knowing that you can survive regional outages.  Cassandra's data model offers the convenience of column indexes with the performance of log-structured updates, strong support for denormalization and materialized views, and powerful built-in caching.	1	img/software/cassandra.png	WrappedArray(Database, NoSQL, Java, JVM, Eventually Consistent, Transactional)	Apache Cassandra
Distributed Cache	Tachyon is a memory-centric distributed storage system enabling reliable data sharing at memory-speed across cluster frameworks.	2	img/software/tachyon.png	WrappedArray(Distributed Cache, Object Store, S3, Swift, HDFS)	Tachyon
Cluster Provision	The Apache Ambari project is aimed at making Hadoop management simpler by developing software for provisioning, managing, and monitoring Apache Hadoop clusters. Ambari provides an intuitive, easy-to-use Hadoop management web UI backed by its RESTful APIs.	3	img/software/ambari.png	WrappedArray(Cluster Provision, Hadoop, Cluster Monitoring, REST API, Metrics, Alerts)	Apache Ambari
Category	Docker allows you to package an application with all of its dependencies into a standardized unit for software and provides an integrated technology suite that enables development and IT operations teams to build, ship, and run distributed applications anywhere.	4	img/software/docker.png	WrappedArray(Container, Linux, DevOps, Deployment)	Docker

Data Processing Execution Engine	Apache Spark is fast and general compute engine for Hadoop data.  Spark provides a simple and expressive programming model that supports a wide range of applications, including ETL, machine learning, stream processing, and graph computation.	7	img/software/spark.png	WrappedArray(Data Procesing Execution Engine, Java, Scala, JVM, SQL, R, Python, DataFrame, Table, DataStream, Streaming Analytics, Batch Analytics, Machine Learning, Graph Analytics, Approximations, Sampling, Lazy)	Apache Spark
Library	Flume is a distributed, reliable, and available service for efficiently collecting, aggregating, and moving large amounts of log data. It has a simple and flexible architecture based on streaming data flows. It is robust and fault tolerant with tunable reliability mechanisms and many failover and recovery mechanisms. It uses a simple extensible data model that allows for online analytic application.	8	img/software/flume.png	WrappedArray(Library, Java, JVM, Log Collection)	Apache Flume

File System	 A distributed file system that provides high-throughput access to application data.	10	img/software/hdfs.png	WrappedArray(File System, Hadoop, Java, JVM)	Apache HDFS
Cluster Resource Manager	A framework for job scheduling and cluster resource management.	11	img/software/yarn.png	WrappedArray(Cluster Resource Manager, Hadoop, Java, JVM)	Apache YARN
Database	Use Apache HBase software when you need random, realtime read/write access to your Big Data. This project's goal is the hosting of very large tables -- billions of rows X millions of columns -- atop clusters of commodity hardware. HBase is an open-source, distributed, versioned, column-oriented store modeled after Google's Bigtable: A Distributed Storage System for Structured Data by Chang et al. Just as Bigtable leverages the distributed data storage provided by the Google File System, HBase provides Bigtable-like capabilities on top of Hadoop and HDFS.	12	img/software/hbase.png	WrappedArray(Database, Hadoop, NoSQL, Java, JVM, Eventually Consistent)	Apache HBase

paragraphs.title: Define Domain-specific Case Class and Jaccard Similarity Algorithm
Convert Row into Item

result.msg:
import org.apache.spark.sql.Row
itemsRDD: org.apache.spark.rdd.RDD[Item] = MapPartitionsRDD[15136] at map at <console>:89

paragraphs.title: Define Exact Jaccard Similarity Algo
paragraphs.text:
def getJaccardSimilarity(item1: Item, item2: Item): Double = {
  val intersectTagSize = (item1.tags & item2.tags).size
  val unionTagSize = (item1.tags ++ item2.tags).size
    
  val jaccardSimilarity = 
    if (unionTagSize > 0) intersectTagSize.toDouble / unionTagSize.toDouble
  	else 0.0

  jaccardSimilarity
}

paragraphs.title: Cluster Details
paragraphs.text:
// Enrich the cluster assignment tuples with itemsDF
val enrichedItemsClustersDF = clusterAssignmentsDF.select($"clusterId", $"itemId")
  .join(itemsDF.select($"id", $"title", $"tags"), $"itemId" === $"id").select($"itemId", $"clusterId", $"title", $"tags").sort($"clusterId", $"itemId")
  
z.show(enrichedItemsClustersDF)
